channel.title: How to take care of laptop battery?
channel.description:
i tired googling it, too many diffrent answers.
so how do you take care of it, leave it on charge, or after its fully charged fully discharge and recharge it?, or ??
any tips on how to maintain it and how to charge it? should i fully let it discharge before charging it or charge it when its half way discharged??
your input is helpfull
thanks in advance.

item.title: How to take care of laptop battery?
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

according to hp, if i am on wall socket all the time, take out battery, after full charge and store in.
and calibrate it once a month or so

item.title: How to take care of laptop battery?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

If you’re using it where you have the ability to plug it in, don’t keep it charging once it is charged for longer than a few hours at a time. Take the charger out, let it run down to like 50 - 60% and put it back on charge for a few hours, and repeat.

Then let it run flat every few weeks if you’re always in a situation where you’re at a wall plug. It has worked for me, 209 charge cycles, 99% battery health.

Read full topic
item.source: How to take care of laptop battery?

item.title: How to take care of laptop battery?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

A lithium-ion battery provides 300-500 discharge/charge cycles. The battery prefers a partial rather than a full discharge. Frequent full discharges should be avoided when possible. Instead, charge the battery more often or use a larger battery. There is no concern of memory when applying unscheduled charges.

Although lithium-ion is memory-free in terms of performance deterioration, batteries with fuel gauges exhibit what engineers refer to as “digital memory”. Here is the reason: Short discharges with subsequent recharges do not provide the periodic calibration needed to synchronize the fuel gauge with the battery’s state-of-charge. A deliberate full discharge and recharge every 30 charges corrects this problem. Letting the battery run down to the cut-off point in the equipment will do this. If ignored, the fuel gauge will become increasingly less accurate.


http://www.batteryuniversity.com/parttwo-34.htm

So you shouldn’t fully discharge the battery unless the power meter is wrong, because this reduces the life of the battery.

I’m not really sure what you should do about leaving it charging though. My old dell battery died because it was continuously charging and discharging, but obviously this was not normal and was caused by some other fault. Like mwiebelhaus, I ordered an unofficial higher capacity battery and it’s worked fine since. Dell conspiracy…

Read full topic
item.source: How to take care of laptop battery?

item.title: How to take care of laptop battery?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Theres so many different opininons that you shouldn’t worry about it. By the time you will need a new one it will be around 30-40 dollars if you buy off ebay, and I got a higher capacity batter for less that dells lowest capacity oem battery.
